pubinfo.publish: Geographic Information Services Unit, Oregon Department of Transportation (ODOT)

descript.abstract: This file contains location and identification information for bridges in Oregon. This includes bridges owned by the state, cities, counties, and other owners such as railroad bridges that cross state highways. It does not include bridges that are owned by Federal agencies. A bridge is a structure including supports erected over a depression or an obstruction, such as water, highway, or railway, and having a track or passageway for carrying traffic or other moving loads and having an opening measured along the center of the roadway of more than 20 feet.
descript.purpose: The layer was developed to show how individual bridges fit into the transportation system. This layer is the base layer for all bridge information. From this base layer, decisions can be made about detours for individual bridges, and to coordinate construction sequences that allow for continuous freight movement.
descript.supplinf: Bridges include culverts on the state highway system that have an opening of as little as 6 ft. For city and county bridges, all structures with an opening of 20 feet are included. Some cities and counties have provided information on structures with an opening of less than 20 feet. Tunnels are also included, as are structures that do not carry traffic but are over the state highway system. Sign bridges, pedestrian bridges, railroad bridges, and flumes are examples of bridges that do not carry highway traffic. Related Studies: Bridge Rail study on Bridge Management Server (SQL) is where the Rail ratings and rail material data is from. The amount of updates for this study is unknown. Limitations: Local Bridges have Lat long coordinates from unknown origin. About 50% have been confirmed or recalculated for precise measurements. All structures classified as bridges in the state will never be fully cataloged. While the data on all state owned NBI bridges are complete, local culverts, cattle passes, sign structures, and other small structures are still being found in Oregon. An exhaustive set of these may never be found. Almost all the data (any from the bridge inspection reports) was calculated in the field by an engineer taking measurements of the bridge. Any data from the Bridge Load Rating database was calculated in the office by engineers.

cntorgp.cntorg: Bridge Section, Oregon Department of Transportation (ODOT)

idinfo.datacred: Oregon Department of Transportation, Technical Services Branch, Bridge Section

attracc.attraccr: Data is obtained from Bridge Section in Excel Spreadsheet. Bridges are geolocated by Latitude and Longitude coordinates in ArcGIS 10.2.2. Bridges are checked by the Bridge Section for accuracy.

dataqual.logic: The bridge locations (points) were geolocated by Latitude and Longitude coordinates. The points and associated data were then reviewed by the Bridge Section to verify accuracy.
dataqual.complete: Complete at the time of posting.

horizpa.horizpar: No horizontal positional accuracy has been determined.

vertacc.vertaccr: No vertical positional accuracy has been determined.

pubinfo.publish: Geographic Information Services Unit, Oregon Department of Transportation (ODOT)

procstep.procdesc: Bridge data is provided in Excel Spreadsheet. Bridge locations are geolocated by Latitude and Longitude coordinates using ArcGIS 10.2.2. Fields names and lengths were edited using ET GeoWizards. Date fields were added using the "add date field" tool in the ODOT toolbox. Most of the data is collected by the bridge inspectors who go on site and physically measure and record the data. The information is stored in an SQL server with the Bridge Management System program of Pontis as the interface. Data on load capacity is calculated at a later date in the office using AASHTO code. Data is stored on the Bridge Server. The bridge rail data is also on the bridge server, in an access database.

Condition of culvert
attr.attrdefs: Federal highway Administration, "Recording and Coding Guide for the Structure Inventory and Appraisal of the Nation's Bridges"

edom.edomvd: Bridge closed. Replacement necessary
edom.edomvds: Federal highway Administration, "Recording and Coding Guide for the Structure Inventory and Appraisal of the Nation's Bridges"

edom.edomvd: Bridge closed. Correction action may put back in light of service.
edom.edomvds: Federal highway Administration, "Recording and Coding Guide for the Structure Inventory and Appraisal of the Nation's Bridges"

edom.edomvd: Integral wingwalls collapsed, severe settlement of roadway due to loss of fill. Section of culvert may have failed and can no longer support embankment. Complete undermining at curtain walls and pipes. Corrective action required to maintain traffic. Metal culverts have extreme distortion and deflection throughout with extensive perforations due to corrosion.
edom.edomvds: Federal highway Administration, "Recording and Coding Guide for the Structure Inventory and Appraisal of the Nation's Bridges"

edom.edomvd: Any condition described in Code 4 but which is excessive in scope. Severe movement or differential settlement of the segments, or loss of fill. Holes may exist in walls or slabs. Integral wingwalls nearly severed from culverts. Severe scour or erosion at curtain walls, wingwalls, extensive corrosion, or deep pitting with scatter perforations.
edom.edomvds: Federal highway Administration, "Recording and Coding Guide for the Structure Inventory and Appraisal of the Nation's Bridges"

edom.edomvd: Large spalls, heavy scaling, wide cracks, considerable efflorescence, or join permitting loss of backfill. Considerable settlement or misalignment. Considerable scouring or erosion at curtain walls, wingwalls, or pipes. Metal culverts have significant distortion and deflection throughout, extensive corrosion or deep pitting.
edom.edomvds: Federal highway Administration, "Recording and Coding Guide for the Structure Inventory and Appraisal of the Nation's Bridges"

edom.edomvd: Moderate to major deterioration or disintegration, extensive cracking and leaching, or spalls on concrete or masonry walls and slabs. Minor settlement or misalignment. Noticeable scouring or erosion at curtain walls, wingwalls, or pipes. Metal culverts have significant distortion and deflection in one section, significant corrosion or deep pitting.
edom.edomvds: Federal highway Administration, "Recording and Coding Guide for the Structure Inventory and Appraisal of the Nation's Bridges"

edom.edomvd: Deterioration or initial disintegration, minor chloride contamination, cracking, with some leaching, or spalls on concrete or masonry walls and slabs. Local minor scouring at curtain walls, wingwalls, or significant corrosion or moderate pitting.
edom.edomvds: Federal highway Administration, "Recording and Coding Guide for the Structure Inventory and Appraisal of the Nation's Bridges"

edom.edomvd: Shrinkage cracks, light scaling, and insignificant spalling which does not expose reinforcing steel. Insignificant damage caused by drift with no misalignment and not requiring corrective action. Some minor scouring has occurred near curtain walls, wingwalls, or pipes. Metal culverts have a smooth symmetrical curvature with superficial corrosion and no pitting.
edom.edomvds: Federal highway Administration, "Recording and Coding Guide for the Structure Inventory and Appraisal of the Nation's Bridges"

edom.edomvd: No noticeable or noteworthy deficiencies which affect the condition of the culvert.
edom.edomvds: Federal highway Administration, "Recording and Coding Guide for the Structure Inventory and Appraisal of the Nation's Bridges"

edom.edomvd: No deficiencies
edom.edomvds: Federal highway Administration, "Recording and Coding Guide for the Structure Inventory and Appraisal of the Nation's Bridges"

edom.edomvd: Not Applicable. Use if structure is not a culvert.
edom.edomvds: Federal highway Administration, "Recording and Coding Guide for the Structure Inventory and Appraisal of the Nation's Bridges"

attr.attrdef: Width of bridge deck on roadway (in feet).
Structural design of bridge

edom.edomvd: A vertical lift bridge or lift bridge is a type of moveable bridge in which a span rises vertically while remaining parallel with the deck.
A bascule bridge is a moveable bridge with a counterweight that continuously balances the span, or "leaf", throughout the entire upward swing in providing clearance for boat traffic.

A swing bridge is a movable bridge that has as its primary structural support a vertical locating pin and support ring at or near to its center, about which the turning span can then pivot horizontally.
A culvert is a conduit used to enclose a flowing body of water. It may be used to allow water to pass railway or embankment, for example.

edom.edomvd: "Imminent" Failure Condition - Major deterioration or section loss present in critical structural components or obvious vertical or horizontal movment affecting structure stability. Bridge is closed to traffic but corrective action may put it back in light service.

edom.edomvd: Critical Condition - advanced deterioration of primary strucutral elements. Fatigue cracks in steel or shear cracks in concrete may be present or scour may have removed substructure support. Unless closely monitored it may be necessary to close the bridge until corrective action is taken.
edom.edomvds: Federal Highway Administration, "Recording and Coding Guide for the Structure Inventory and Appraisal of the Nation's Bridges"

edom.edomvd: Serious Condition - loss of section, deterioration, spalling or scour have seriously affected primary strutural components. Local failures are possible. Fatigue cracks in steel or shear cracks in concrete may be present.
edom.edomvds: Federal Highway Administration, "Recording and Coding Guide for the Structure Inventory and Appraisal of the Nation's Bridges"

edom.edomvd: Poor Condition - advanced section loss, deterioration, spalling or scour

edom.edomvd: Fair Condition - all primary structural elements are sound but may have minor section loss, cracking, spalling or scour.
edom.edomvds: Federal Highway Administration, "Recording and Coding Guide for the Structure Inventory and Appraisal of the Nation's Bridges"

edom.edomvd: Satisfactory Condition - structural elements show some minor deterioration
edom.edomvds: Federal Highway Administration, "Recording and Coding Guide for the Structure Inventory and Appraisal of the Nation's Bridges"

edom.edomvd: Good Condition - some minor problems
edom.edomvds: Federal Highway Administration, "Recording and Coding Guide for the Structure Inventory and Appraisal of the Nation's Bridges"

edom.edomvd: Very Good Condition - no problem noted
edom.edomvds: Federal Highway Administration, "Recording and Coding Guide for the Structure Inventory and Appraisal of the Nation's Bridges"

edom.edomvd: Excellent condition
edom.edomvds: Federal Highway Administration, "Recording and Coding Guide for the Structure Inventory and Appraisal of the Nation's Bridges"

edom.edomvd: Not Applicable
edom.edomvds: Federal Highway Administration, "Recording and Coding Guide for the Structure Inventory and Appraisal of the Nation's Bridges"
Federal Highway Administration, "Recording and Coding Guide for the Structure Inventory and Appraisal of the Nation's Bridges"

attr.attrdef: Rail Material
Rail Rating

The population of bridges that have a span of less than 200 ft. and have rating factors less than 1.3 for the three standard legal load vehicles. FHWA has given a deadline of December 31st 2017 to have all of these bridges evaluated for the SHV loads.
Scour Critical Bridges (at risk of failure due to scour).
attr.attrdefs: Federal Highway Administration, "Recording and Coding Guide for the Structure Inventory and Appraisal of the Nation's Bridges"

edom.edomvd: Bridge is scour critical. Bridge has failed and is closed to traffic.
edom.edomvds: Federal Highway Administration, "Recording and Coding guide for the Structure Inventory and Appraisal of the Nation's Bridges"

edom.edomvd: Bridge is scour critical; field review indicates that failure of piers/abutments is imminent.
edom.edomvds: Federal Highway Administration, "Recording and Coding guide for the Structure Inventory and Appraisal of the Nation's Bridges"

edom.edomvd: Bridge is scour critical; filed review indicates that extensive scour has occurred at bridge foundations. Immediate action is required to provide scour countermeasures.
edom.edomvds: Federal Highway Administration, "Recording and Coding guide for the Structure Inventory and Appraisal of the Nation's Bridges"

edom.edomvd:
Bridge is scour critical; bridge foundations determined to be stable for calculated scour conditions:
- scour within limits
- scour below spread-footing base or pile tips.
edom.edomvds: Federal Highway Administration, "Recording and Coding guide for the Structure Inventory and Appraisal of the Nation's Bridges"

edom.edomvd: Bridge foundations determined to be stable for calculated scour conditions; field review indicates action is required to protect exposed foundations from effects of additional erosion and corrosion.
edom.edomvds: Federal Highway Administration, "Recording and Coding guide for the Structure Inventory and Appraisal of the Nation's Bridges"

edom.edomvd: Bridge foundations determined to be stable for calculated scour conditions; scour within limits of footing or piles.
edom.edomvds: Federal Highway Administration, "Recording and Coding guide for the Structure Inventory and Appraisal of the Nation's Bridges"

edom.edomvd: Scour calculation evaluation has not been made
edom.edomvds: Federal Highway Administration, "Recording and Coding guide for the Structure Inventory and Appraisal of the Nation's Bridges"

edom.edomvd: Countermeasures have been installed to correct a previously existing problem with scour. Bridge is no longer scour critical.
edom.edomvds: Federal Highway Administration, "Recording and Coding guide for the Structure Inventory and Appraisal of the Nation's Bridges"

edom.edomvd: Bridge foundations determined to be stable for assessed or calculated scour conditions; calculated scour is above top of footing.
edom.edomvds: Federal Highway Administration, "Recording and Coding guide for the Structure Inventory and Appraisal of the Nation's Bridges"

edom.edomvd: Bridge foundations (including piles) or dry land well above flood water elevations.
edom.edomvds: Federal Highway Administration, "Recording and Coding guide for the Structure Inventory and Appraisal of the Nation's Bridges"

edom.edomvd: Bridge not over waterway.
edom.edomvds: Federal Highway Administration, "Recording and Coding guide for the Structure Inventory and Appraisal of the Nation's Bridges"

edom.edomvd: Bridge over "tidal" waters that has not been evaluated for scour, but considered low risk. Bridge will be monitored with regular inspection cycle and with appropriate underwater inspections.
edom.edomvds: Federal Highway Administration, "Recording and Coding guide for the Structure Inventory and Appraisal of the Nation's Bridges"

edom.edomvd: Bridge with "unknown" foundation that has not been evaluated for scour. Since risk cannot be determined, flag for monitoring during flood events, and if appropriate, closure.
edom.edomvds: Federal Highway Administration, "Recording and Coding guide for the Structure Inventory and Appraisal of the Nation's Bridges"

attr.attrdef: Sufficiency rating is a computed numerical value that is used to determine eligibility of a bridge for Federal funding. The sufficiency rating formula result varies from 0 to 100. The formula includes factors for structural condition, bridge geometry, and traffic considerations. The sufficiency rating formula is contained in the December 1995 Edition of the ?Recording and Coding Guide for the Structure Inventory and Appraisal of the Nation?s Bridges?. A bridge with a sufficiency rating of 80 or less is eligible for Federal bridge rehabilitation funding. A bridge with a sufficiency rating of 50 or less is eligible for Federal bridge replacement funding.
Superstructure rating

edom.edomvd: Failed Condition - out of service - beyond corrective action
